Interrogator: Described the man who took the ride.
Interrogee: So, the man who took the ride was quite muscular he was well dressed he was wearing some coat and he has some folder in his hand and he was carrying a laptop bag since he was going to attend a seminar

Interrogator: Why was the man in Hurry and whom did he call
Interrogee: So man was in hurry because he was the chief guest of a seminar and he was there going there to deliver some speech and he called the cab Customer Care regarding his cab driver being late

So, the taxi driver was rude. He was wearing some kind of cap, and he continuously was blabbering about how his night had been ruined because you called on me at the last minute. He kept saying that he was done for the day. Yes, he was rude.

Interrogator: Okay, so describe the behavior of the taxi driver towards the passenger.
Interrogee: So, the taxi driver was quite mad at the passenger. He said, 'You are the reason why I'm here at this late hour, and you will be going to pay me extra, either I will not take your ride

Interrogator: When the man entered the taxi, what did he observe?
Interrogee: So when the man entered the taxi, he observed that the taxi was not in a very good condition. The seats were all in shambles, and there were cuts and bruises on the seat. It was quite stinky

Interrogator: And how much extra did he say that he wanted?
Interrogee: He said he will take at least two to three thousand extra, and when the man said that he didn't have any cash, he suggested taking other forms of payment, such as the man's watch

Interrogator: why didn't he informed the customer care?
Interrogee: So the man was in quite a hurry; he was already half an hour to two hours late, and since he had no other option and it was getting late, he opted to take the ride.

Interrogator: When the man came to the taxi, what did they do? Did they have a conversation about anything in the cab?
Interrogee: No, they continuously argued about how the man kept saying that he was getting late and the driver should drive faster, while the driver continuously insisted that the man shouldn't order him around. He stated that he was there because of the man and that the man should just sit quietly while he took his time to get him to his destination.

Interrogator: Did they talk about their families?
Interrogee: No, there was no conversation, but during an argument, he mentioned that as a taxi driver, I only get very few hours to spend with my family, and you have ruined these hours.

Interrogator: Did he talk about who are the members in his family?
So, did the man comment anything about the passenger's watch?
Interrogee: Yes, as soon as the passenger mentioned that he did not have any cash, the cab driver noticed his watch and said that it looked like quite an expensive watch, and he would take it as a form of payment.

Interrogator: And what did the passenger comment about the taxi driver's watch?
Interrogee: Yeah, the taxi driver was wearing quite an old watch, and as the taxi driver demanded his watch, the man said, 'From the look of your watch, I think that you need this watch.'

Interrogator: Was there anything unique about the taxi driver's watch
Interrogee: Nothing was unique; it was a regular golden color chain watch.

Interrogator: What happened at the end of his ride?
Interrogee: At the end of the ride, the customer, the man, left the cab and gave his watch to the cab driver. Then he entered the seminar hall.

Interrogator: Did he receive any call anything?
Interrogee: He received a popup message from the app saying asking for feedback and he just ignored them as he then enter the seminar.

Interrogator: You did not see a witness anything else?
And did the passanger talk about his own family.
Interrogee: No the passanger never mentioned his family.

Interrogator: And did the passanger mentioned his reason of his visit to the seminar to the taxi driver.
Interrogee: Yes, he mentioned few times that without him the seminar will not start and he is the chief guest of the seminar and you should hurry to get me there.

Interrogator: What kind of seminar was that?
